document.discussion_title: Fines rocket to £2m for nuisance calls firms
document.topic_text: Fines rocket to £2m for nuisance calls firms The government’s data protection regulator has issued fines totalling more than £2m since the law was changed 12 months ago to make it easier to crack down on nuisance marketing and phone calls, it revealed today. Following the change in the law in April 2015, the penalties levied by the Information Commissioners’ Office (ICO) on companies found to be breaking the law compare with just £360,000 during the previous 12 months. This week the ICO will fine a Scottish firm for making 2.5 million recorded calls in an effort to sell its home improvement services.
